com.googlecode.sarasvati
Interface Engine

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseEngine, HibEngine, MemEngine, NonRecursiveEngine
public interface Engine

An Engine executes a process. A Graph specifies how it should be executed and a Process tracks the current state of execution. But it is an Engine which create instances of ArcToken, NodeToken and Process and which invokes Node.guard(Engine, NodeToken) and Node.execute(Engine, NodeToken).

Author:
Paul Lorenz

Method Detail

startWorkflow

Process startWorkflow(Graph graph)
Given a Graph, creates a new Process executing that graph. A NodeToken will be generated on each start nodes (determined by Graph.getStartNodes()), and these NodeTokens will be executed. If the graph does not contain Nodes which go into a wait state, the Process returned will be completed.

Parameters:
graph - The Graph to execute.
Returns:
A Process executing the given Graph.

startWorkflow

void startWorkflow(Process process)
Sometimes it is desirable to separate process creation from starting execution of the process. For example, one may wish to set some variables into the process environment before starting execution. startWorkflow will generate a new NodeToken on each start node contained in the given process.

Parameters:
process - The process on which to begin execution.

newNodeToken

NodeToken newNodeToken(Process process,
                       Node node,
                       List<ArcToken> parents)
Generates a new NodeToken for the given Process, pointing to the given Node.

Parameters:
process - The Process which the new NodeToken will belong to
node - The Node the new NodeToken is being placed on
parents - The list of ArcTokens which preceded this NodeToken
Returns:
A new NodeToken

newArcToken

ArcToken newArcToken(Process process,
                     Arc arc,
                     NodeToken parent)
Generates a new ArcToken for the given Process, pointing to the given Arc.

Parameters:
process - The Process which the new ArcToken will belong to
arc - The Arc the new ArcToken is being placed on
parent - The NodeToken which preceded this ArcToken.
Returns:
A new ArcToken

newProcess

Process newProcess(Graph graph)
Generates a new Process for the given Graph. Execution of the process is not started by this method. The method will be used by startWorkflow(Graph), and should not need to be called otherwise.

Parameters:
graph - The Graph the Process will be executing.
Returns:
A new Process

completeExecution

void completeExecution(NodeToken token,
                       String arcName)
Continues execution of a process in a wait state. If a call to Node.execute(Engine, NodeToken) does not contain a call to completeExecution(NodeToken, String), then execution of the graph will halt at that point. This is generally referred to as a wait state. It may happen, for example, if the action represented by that node must be done by a human or some external system. When the external system has determined that the Node has completed its work, it should invoke this method to continue executing the process.

Parameters:
token - The NodeToken to resume execution on
arcName - The name of the Arc (or arcs, as more than one Arc can have the same name) to generate ArcTokens on.
